#summary Human Spinal Lumbar Nerves
[Home] -> [BiologicalLifeResearch] -> [HumanNerves] -> [HumanNervesSpinalLumbar]
----

This page is intended to list lumbar spinal cord nerves of biological human, which connect mind to human limbs and visceral organs.

<wiki:toc max_depth="2" />

Coverage verified by:
  * http://medical-dictionary.thefreedictionary.com/nerve (name base)
  * http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves (MA reference)

   * *L3 nerve, dorsal ramus*; DISTRIBUTION={medial - to multifidus, lateral - cutaneous branches, supply skin of gluteal region}
   * *L3 nerve, ventral ramus*; DISTRIBUTION={1 - to lateral cutaneous nerve of thigh, 2 - to femoral nerve, 3 - to accessory obturator nerve, 4 - to obturator nerve}
  * *L4 nerve* (MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne45.htm L4 NERVE]); ORIGIN={Spinal cord segment L4}; BRANCHES={dorsal - medial, lateral; ventral - 1-4 branches}; MODALITY={motor and general sensory}
